ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic features include hypertelorism, orofacial clefts (particularly cleft lip/palate), and sleep disturbances are common due to seizures and developmental issues.
X-linked disorder characterized by hypertelorism as a cardinal feature and midline defects including cleft lip/palate. Sleep issues can occur secondary to respiratory problems.
Features prominent hypertelorism and midline facial clefts. Sleep abnormalities may be present due to airway obstruction from craniofacial anomalies.
Can present with hypertelorism, cleft palate (particularly submucous), and sleep disorders including sleep apnea and behavioral sleep problems.
Features can include mild hypertelorism, cleft palate in ~35% of cases, and sleep disturbances are reported in some patients with behavioral issues.
X-linked disorder with hypertelorism as a key feature. Cleft lip/palate occurs in some cases, and sleep problems may occur with associated ADHD.
X-linked disorder with severe hypertelorism and midline defects including clefting. Sleep issues possible due to craniofacial abnormalities affecting breathing.
